intro: Pneumonanthe catesbaei, commonly known as the Florida flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular red flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of streams, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat conservation.
